About Pirate Math Equation Quest

Pirate Math Equation Quest is a FREE word-problem intervention designed to offer support to Tier-2 and Tier-3 students in the elementary grades who require supplemental remediation in the area of word-problem solving. It was developed by researchers at the Meadows Center for Preventing Educational Risk with funding from the Institute of Education Sciences.

Students receive explicit instruction on reading, interpreting, setting up, and solving word problems with a focus on schemas. Students also receive modeling and practice related to understanding the equal sign and equation solving within the word-problem intervention.

Website Materials

The Pirate Math Equation Quest website includes all teacher, student, and supplemental materials for three versions of the word-problem intervention at NO COST:

Individual intervention
Small-group intervention
Test prep intervention

The website also houses videos that demonstrate how to implement all intervention components. http://www.piratemathequationquest.com/individual.html

A reminder community, the flu season this year has been a particularly bad one according to the CDC. "One reason flu has been so severe for children this season is that they're particularly susceptible to influenza B, this season's dominant strain. Compared with flu A, flu B is relatively stable and doesn't change as much from year to year, so many adults have immunity to it from infections earlier in life." (CNN)
We have seen some cases of flu, bronchitis, and strep on campus over the last two weeks. Please reinforce good hygiene reminders, washing hands regularly, covering coughs and sneezes, not sharing food or beverages, keeping personal space, and letting adults know if they aren't feeling well.
In this day and age of modern medicine, it's easy to forget how dangerous the flu can be. There have been roughly 140,000 flu hospitalizations and roughly 8,200 flu deaths according to the CDC, so we hope you all take time for rest and healthy foods and drinks to keep your bodies strong.

From early childhood to middle school, come see if the Montessori Method of education is one in which you feel your children will thrive. All lead teachers and directors at both Mi Casita and CC-Montessori are certified Montessori teachers.

Montessori focuses on instilling the joy of learning in children from a young age. It sets boundaries but gives responsibility and choice to the child to help build intrinsic value in learning. “Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.” ― Maria Montessori

Montessori education is a whole child approach to learning that focuses on helping children to problem solve not only scholastically but socially as well. The goal is to have a child that feels independent, supported, and successful.

A disturbing but needful read. As our winter break approaches and those that celebrate the holidays come together to exchange gifts, it's important to consider how their new tech toys can influence them and what doors open from the outside world to your child.
Many games that are geared for elementary to middle grades have open chat features. Have you had a talk with your children about what to do if they are approached or sent something inappropriate online? Please take some time and have this very important talk with your children. Please share the article with your friends and family with children that play games or use services such as Fortnight, Roblox, Steam, Discord, Twitch, Xbox, Playstation, TicTok, Facebook Messenger, Kik, Skype, Omegle, Tumblr, etc. "Sexual predators and other bad actors have found an easy access point into the lives of young people: They are meeting them online through multiplayer video games and chat apps, making virtual connections right in their victims’ homes." We hope this helps others become aware!

Texas Baker's Bill
April 24, 2019 at 9:08 PM ·

HB 2108, the Cottage Food Freedom Bill, has just been voted out of House committee by a 9-1 vote! Next step: Calendars! Everybody get your calling fingers warmed up!

This bill:

- Removes the location restriction. It allows the sale of cottage foods directly to consumers anywhere in the state.
- Allows internet sales as long as one portion of the sale takes place in person.
- Allows ANY non-potentially hazardous food (in other words, it gets rid of the specific list that we are currently operating with).
- Adds pickled fruits and vegetables including pickled beets and carrots.
- Adds canned goods that are acidified
- Adds fermented vegetables
- Adds frozen fruits and vegetables
- DOES NOT ADD any new regulatory burdens for cottage food producers.

Read the bill:
https://capitol.texas.gov/BillLookup/History.aspx?LegSess=86R&Bill=HB2108

- Removes the location restriction. It allows the sale of cottage foods directly to consumers anywhere in the state.
- Allows internet sales as long as one portion of the sale takes place in person.
- Allows ANY non-potentially hazardous food (in other words, it gets rid of the specific list that we are currently operating with).
- Adds pickled fruits and vegetables including pickled beets and carrots.
- Adds canned goods that are acidified
- Adds fermented vegetables
- Adds frozen fruits and vegetables
- DOES NOT ADD any new regulatory burdens for cottage food producers.

Read the bill:
https://capitol.texas.gov/BillLookup/History.aspx?LegSess=86R&Bill=HB2108

It's bound to happen each year, head lice find there way into our environments and the battle begins. There are many treatment methods available. The slide show below offer a bit of information on treatments and prevention.

Quick Tips:

Remember look for lice and nits with a good bright light. It makes their shiny bodies much easier to find.

The best method is always to comb and pick. A hair drier on hot is a handy helper.

They can only crawl so mak sure beding, hats, scarves, and recently worn clothing are all washed in hot water and dried on the hot setting. Boil combs and brushes.

The lice in Texas are resistent to many over the counter treatments so be aware!

We hope you find this helpful!

By The Book Bookstore
January 14, 2019 at 2:11 PM ·

In order to boost children literacy levels here in the Corpus Christi area, By The Book Bookstore wants to giveaway ONE FREE BOOK-A-DAY so that parents, teachers, and most importantly children can have access to a book when they want to read.

Children and adults need access to books in their neighborhood or school to inspire reading. It is through "adult support" and "access to books" combined that will encourage parents and teachers to read to children.

Research has found that by providing greater access through close proximity to books and adult support for book reading enhanced children's opportunity to learn.

Beginning tomorrow, January 15, 2019 @ 12PM, By The Book Bookstore will give away one book through our social media page everyday.

Please give us a LIKE on our page and SHARE this post to give everyone a chance to get a book. It will be on a first come, first serve basis. Let's boost those literacy levels starting right now!!!

1. No scary/bloody/gory costumes.
2. No fake weapons
3. No masks.
The parade will go around the basketball court at 3pm for our costumed children. Parents are welcome to come and take pics; however, if you can’t make it, our staff will take pictures and post in the parent Facebook page.

Please email or call with questions or concerns!
